sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Discipline and Rules-Based Execution in HIPO Response
feed.summary: This report analyzes Hippo Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: HIPO), identifying a mid-channel oscillation pattern and divergent sentiment across various time horizons, suggesting choppy market conditions. It highlights an exceptional risk-reward setup with a 55.1:1 ratio, targeting a 15.0% gain against a 0.3% risk. The article outlines specific institutional trading strategies including position trading, momentum breakout, and risk hedging, along with multi-timeframe signal analysis.

feed.title: Hippo Holdings Inc. (NYSE:HIPO) Given Average Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" by Analysts
feed.summary: Analysts have given Hippo Holdings Inc. (NYSE:HIPO) an average "Moderate Buy" rating, with a consensus 12-month price target of $37.50. The company recently surpassed earnings and revenue expectations, reporting $0.70 EPS against an estimated $0.04 and $120.6 million in revenue. Despite recent insider stock sales, institutional investors and hedge funds hold a significant portion of the company's shares.

feed.title: Richard Mccathron Sells 5,000 Shares of Hippo (NYSE:HIPO) Stock
feed.summary: Richard Mccathron, CEO of Hippo (NYSE:HIPO), sold 5,000 shares of the company's stock for $149,100 on December 9th. This transaction reduced his ownership by 1.09% to 452,704 shares. The sale followed a strong quarterly earnings report where Hippo exceeded revenue and EPS expectations, though analysts still forecast a negative EPS for the current fiscal year.

feed.title: Insider Sell Alert: Richard Mccathron Sells 5,000 Shares of Hipp
feed.summary: Richard Mccathron, CEO of Hippo Holdings Inc (HIPO), sold 5,000 shares of the company on December 9, 2025, bringing his total holdings to 452,704 shares. This transaction is part of a pattern for the past year where insiders at Hippo Holdings have only sold shares, with Mccathron himself having sold 10,000 shares and made no purchases. The stock is currently trading at $29.82, and GuruFocus classifies it as fairly valued with a price-to-GF-Value ratio of 0.92.

feed.title: Hippo Holdings stock price target raised to $34 by KBW on earnings beat
feed.summary: KBW has increased its price target for Hippo Holdings (NYSE:HIPO) to $34.00 from $33.00, while maintaining a "Market Perform" rating, following the company's strong third-quarter earnings that surpassed analyst expectations. The insurance technology company demonstrated improved underwriting margins and significant revenue growth of 34.41% over the last twelve months, achieving profitability. Despite the positive adjustments to financial models and forward estimates by KBW, the firm noted a gap between its projections and Hippo's ambitious medium-term adjusted net income targets.

feed.title: Hippo Holdings stock price target raised to $34 by KBW on earnings beat
feed.summary: KBW has increased its price target for Hippo Holdings (NYSE:HIPO) to $34 from $33, while maintaining a Market Perform rating, following the company's strong third-quarter earnings. The firm acknowledged Hippo's impressive 34.41% revenue growth and profitability over the past year. However, KBW expressed concerns that Hippo's aggressive growth targets might be challenged by a softening insurance market.

feed.title: Hippo (NYSE:HIPO) Shares Little Changed in NYSE Trade Session
feed.summary: Hippo, a company providing property and casualty insurance through technology-enabled platforms, saw its shares remain little changed during a recent NYSE trade session. The article notes Hippo's focus on enhancing service delivery and operational efficiency within the financial sector. To access the full article, readers are prompted to log in or create an account.

feed.title: Hippo Holdings stock price target raised to $34 by KBW on earnings beat
feed.summary: KBW has raised its price target for Hippo Holdings (NYSE: HIPO) to $34 from $33, while maintaining a Market Perform rating, following the company's strong third-quarter earnings. The insurance technology company exceeded analyst expectations and demonstrated improved underwriting margins, leading KBW to update its financial model. Despite raising forward estimates, KBW expresses concerns about potential risks given Hippo's aggressive growth targets amid a softening insurance market.

feed.title: Behavioral Patterns of HIPO and Institutional Flows
feed.summary: This article analyzes Hippo Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: HIPO) using AI models to identify behavioral patterns and institutional flows. It highlights weak near- and mid-term sentiment but a strong long-term outlook, presenting specific trading strategies and risk-reward setups for different time horizons. The analysis emphasizes an exceptional risk-reward setup targeting a 15.1% gain with minimal risk.

feed.title: Hood River Capital Management LLC Acquires New Holdings in Hippo Holdings Inc. $HIPO
feed.summary: Hood River Capital Management LLC recently acquired a new position in Hippo Holdings Inc. (NYSE:HIPO), purchasing 489,243 shares valued at approximately $13.67 million, representing 1.94% of the company. The insurance provider reported a quarterly EPS of $0.70 against an expected $0.04 and revenue of $120.6 million, exceeding analyst estimates. Despite a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts, the company shows a negative return on equity and projected negative earnings per share for the current year.

feed.title: Entropy Technologies LP Acquires Shares of 8,485 Hippo Holdings Inc. $HIPO
feed.summary: Entropy Technologies LP has acquired 8,485 shares of Hippo Holdings Inc. ($HIPO) in Q2, valued at approximately $237,000. This comes as Hippo reported strong quarterly earnings, beating consensus estimates with an EPS of $0.70 and revenue of $120.6 million. Despite some insider selling, institutional ownership remains at 43.01%, and analysts rate the stock a "Moderate Buy" with a $35.50 target.

feed.title: Hippo holdings CFO Zeltser sells $58493 in shares
feed.summary: Hippo Holdings Inc.'s CFO, Guy Zeltser, sold $58,493 worth of company stock through a pre-arranged trading plan. This transaction involved 1,819 shares, with prices ranging from $31.52 to $32.74. The company recently reported strong Q3 2025 results, with a 26% revenue increase and an improved net loss ratio, leading to a raised full-year guidance for gross written premiums.

feed.title: Hippo Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: Hippo Holdings Inc. announced its third-quarter 2025 financial results, showing significant improvements with a net income of $98 million compared to a net loss in the prior year, primarily driven by a $91 million gain on the sale of its homebuilder distribution network. The company reported a 33% increase in Gross Written Premium and a 25 percentage point improvement in the Net Loss Ratio, indicating strong operational execution and a shift towards profitable growth and diversification. Key strategic adjustments, including moving to a consolidated financial reporting basis and increasing portfolio diversification, are contributing to a more efficient and resilient organization.

feed.title: Hippo Holdings Inc. (HIPO) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
feed.summary: Hippo Holdings Inc. (HIPO) reported strong Q3 2025 earnings of $0.7 per share, significantly surpassing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $0.04 per share, and revenues of $120.6 million, beating expectations. The company's shares have outperformed the S&P 500 year-to-date, and it currently holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). Investors are now looking at future earnings trends and management commentary for continued stock performance.

feed.title: Hippo Holdings' Spinnaker Insurance Company Celebrates 10 Years of Innovation, Profitable Growth, and Service
feed.summary: Spinnaker Insurance Company, a subsidiary of Hippo Holdings, is celebrating its 10th anniversary, marking a decade of innovation and profitable growth. The company, which provides property and casualty solutions, has grown its gross written premium by 17% year-over-year through the first half of 2025 and maintains a strong financial position with an A- (Excellent) rating from AM Best. Spinnaker attributes its success to strategic vision, diversified risk portfolio, and strong partnerships in the expanding program insurance market.

feed.title: Hippo to Report Third Quarter Financial Results on November 5, 2025 - WV News
feed.summary: Hippo Holdings Inc. announced that it will release its third-quarter financial results before market open on Wednesday, November 5, 2025. The company will host a conference call and live webcast for analysts and investors at 8:00 AM ET/5:00 AM PT on the same day. Hippo is an insurance group utilizing a hybrid fronting platform to diversify risk across personal and commercial lines, offering tailored coverage for homeowners through its Hippo Homeowners Insurance Program.

feed.title: Hippo to Report Third Quarter Financial Results on November 5, 2025 - The AI Journal
feed.summary: Hippo Holdings Inc. (NYSE: HIPO) announced it will release its third-quarter financial results on November 5, 2025, before market open. The company will host a conference call and live webcast for analysts and investors at 8:00 AM ET/5:00 AM PT on the same day to discuss the results. An earnings release will be available on their investor relations website prior to the call.

The company will host a conference call and live webcast for analysts and investors at 8:00 a.m. ET / 5:00 a.m. PT. An earnings release and webcast replay will be available on Hippo's investor relations website.

The company will host a conference call and live webcast for analysts and investors at 8:00 a.m. ET/5:00 a.m. PT on the same day. The company will host a conference call and live webcast for analysts and investors at 8:00 AM ET/5:00 AM PT on the same day. Financial results will be available on the investor relations section of their website prior to the call.

feed.title: Hippo Appoints Insurance Industry Leaders Laura Hay and Susan Holliday to Its Distinguished Board of Directors
feed.summary: Hippo (NYSE: HIPO) has announced the appointments of Laura Hay and Susan Holliday to its Board of Directors. Hay, former Global Head of Insurance for KPMG International, and Holliday, a global insurance expert and former Swiss Re executive, bring extensive experience in insurance and financial services, risk management, and fostering growth. Their appointments are expected to enhance Hippo's strategic direction and strengthen its commitment to customer-centric innovation and sustainable growth.

feed.title: Hippo Appoints Charles Sebaski as Head of Investor Relations
feed.summary: Hippo (NYSE: HIPO) has appointed Charles Sebaski as Head of Investor Relations, where he will report to CFO Guy Zeltser. Sebaski brings over 25 years of insurance industry experience, including more than a decade as an analyst. His role will focus on raising investor and analyst awareness of Hippo's strategy for diversification, market growth, and risk management, particularly in the lead-up to the Q3 2025 earnings call.

feed.title: Hippo Appoints Andrea Collins as Chief Marketing Officer
feed.summary: Hippo (NYSE: HIPO) has appointed Andrea Collins as its new Chief Marketing Officer, marking her return to the company's leadership team. Collins previously served as Hippo's VP of Marketing from 2017 to 2022 and brings over two decades of marketing experience, including roles at cyber insurtech Cowbell and real estate platform Flyhomes. Her new role will focus on driving innovation and brand experience, specifically elevating Hippo and deepening investment in key distribution channels like the New Homes Program.

feed.title: Centana Growth Partners Acquires Majority Stake in First Connect Insurance Services
feed.summary: Centana Growth Partners has acquired a majority stake in First Connect Insurance Services in an investment exceeding $60 million. This funding, with participation from Pruven Capital, Cota Capital, and Cross Creek, will enable First Connect to accelerate product growth and expand market penetration of its insurtech platform. First Connect offers independent agents access to over 100 carriers and MGAs for various insurance lines, streamlining the process with tools like Carrier Store, Appetite Finder, and AI-driven E&O validation.

feed.title: Centana Growth Partners Acquires Majority Stake in Hippo’s First Connect Insurance Services
feed.summary: Centana Growth Partners has acquired a majority stake in First Connect Insurance Services, an insurtech platform formerly a subsidiary of Hippo Holdings Inc. The investment, exceeding $60 million, will allow First Connect to enhance its online platform that digitally connects independent agents and carriers, accelerating product growth and market penetration. Aviad Pinkovezky will lead First Connect as CEO, focusing on strengthening the product and service for agents and carrier partners.

feed.title: Hippo Appoints William Malone as Vice President, Head of Agency
feed.summary: Hippo, the home insurance group, has appointed William Malone as Vice President, Head of Agency. Malone, a 25-year industry veteran with experience at Chubb, Hartford, Liberty Mutual, and GEICO, will lead Hippo's sales, account management, and customer support functions. The company also announced the departure of long-time executive Yuval Harry, who was instrumental in Hippo's growth and previously led the Hippo Agency.

feed.title: Majority of Layoffs in the US Insurance Industry
feed.summary: The US insurance industry experienced significant layoffs, predominantly within the property and casualty (P&C) sector, with over 6,800 jobs cut across approximately 20 companies. Major insurers like Farmers, GEICO, Liberty Mutual, and USAA initiated workforce reductions aiming to streamline operations and refocus strategies. InsurTech companies such as Hippo and Hagerty also underwent layoffs to reduce cash burn, a trend expected to continue into 2024, albeit on a smaller scale.

feed.title: Hippo Holdings Inc (HIPO) Q1 2024 Earnings: Significant Revenue Growth and Improved Loss Ratios
feed.summary: Hippo Holdings Inc (HIPO) reported significant revenue growth of 114% year-over-year in Q1 2024, reaching $85 million, surpassing estimates. Despite a net loss of $36 million, a 49% improvement, the company achieved its first cash flow positive quarter and significantly improved its gross loss ratio, driven by strategic shifts towards its Insurance-as-a-Service and third-party policy offerings. Hippo projects continued revenue growth and a positive adjusted EBITDA by Q4 2024, signaling strong operational improvements despite ongoing challenges.

feed.title: Spinnaker Names Charles Valinotti Chief Program and Underwriting Officer
feed.summary: Spinnaker Insurance Company, a subsidiary of Hippo Holdings Inc., has appointed Charles Valinotti as its Chief Program and Underwriting Officer. Valinotti brings 30 years of experience, including 13 years at QBE Americas, to lead Spinnaker's program underwriting team and manage the carrier’s diverse portfolio of third-party programs. He will also serve as a key interface with program partners, Claims TPAs, reinsurers, and brokers.

feed.title: Shareholders Call for HIPPO Board to Initiate a Strategic Review of Company
feed.summary: A group of HIPPO's top shareholders, holding nearly 2.5% of outstanding common shares, has issued an open letter to the Board of Directors urging an immediate strategic review process. They contend that Hippo Holdings Inc. has generated abysmal financial results since going public in early 2021 and now trades at a significant discount to book value. The Concerned Shareholder Group believes a strategic review, focusing on maximizing value from capital, Spinnaker Insurance Company, and NOLs, along with improved financial disclosures and the election of an independent Chair, Jay Nichols Jr., is crucial to preserve shareholder value.

feed.title: Hippo Unveils New Home Care Experience and Ad Campaign to Help Homeowners ‘Feel the Housepower’
feed.summary: Hippo has launched a new Home Care mobile experience for its customers and an ad campaign to help homeowners 'Feel the Housepower'. This initiative aims to address the anxiety homeowners face regarding maintenance, offering proactive tools like home health assessments and personalized checklists. The new brand campaign emphasizes confidence and control in homeownership, differentiating itself from traditional insurance models.

feed.title: Hippo able to retain more risk if reinsurance costs prove too high: KBW
feed.summary: A KBW note suggests that Hippo Holdings can increase its risk retention if reinsurance costs become too high, as part of its long-term plan to reduce ceding. This flexibility, along with improving loss ratios and diverse programs, positions the company towards its goal of full-year AEBITDA profitability by 2025 despite narrowing Q3 losses. Hippo reported a 36% rise in Q3 revenue with total generated premiums of $219m, and expects improved adjusted EBITDA results moving forward.

feed.title: Hippo’s First Connect Simplifies Agent Onboarding with New Carrier Store and Adds Pacific Specialty Insurance
feed.summary: First Connect Insurance Services, a subsidiary of Hippo, announced the launch of its new Carrier Store and the addition of Pacific Specialty Insurance products. The Carrier Store streamlines the agent onboarding process and helps agents discover new carrier options, while Pacific Specialty Insurance adds a wide range of property and liability products to the platform. This expansion aims to enhance independent agents' access to diverse offerings and grow their footprint.

feed.title: It Starts: Reverse Stock Splits for Collapsed SPACs & IPO Stocks. Bankruptcy for Others
feed.summary: This article discusses the increasing trend of reverse stock splits among "collapsed" SPACs and IPO stocks, often as a measure to avoid delisting after their share prices dropped below $1. It highlights several companies like Hippo Holdings, Enjoy Technology, Electric Last Mile, and Voyager Digital, some of which resorted to reverse splits while others, unable to recover, filed for bankruptcy. The author, Wolf Richter, argues that reverse stock splits only address delisting threats temporarily and do not solve underlying financial viability problems, ultimately predicting that many of these companies will still fail unless they achieve positive cash flow.

feed.title: AmeriSave Insurance Agency Now Offering Homeowners and Other Insurance in Minutes
feed.summary: AmeriSave Mortgage Corporation has launched AmeriSave Insurance Agency in partnership with Hippo, offering a fast and easy way for homebuyers and homeowners to purchase insurance policies. This new service allows customers to compare policies from multiple carriers and complete the purchase transaction in minutes, addressing a previously time-consuming step in the mortgage process. The initiative aims to provide value to borrowers by making homeownership more affordable and accessible through streamlined insurance acquisition.

feed.title: ITC 2021: Rick McCathron, President of Hippo
feed.summary: Rick McCathron, President of Hippo, discussed the company's journey to becoming public at InsureTech Connect 2021, detailing its substantial funding rounds and C-level appointments. He emphasized Hippo's mission of holistic home protection through smart home technology and proactive risk mitigation. The article highlights Hippo's strategic growth, including geographic expansion, diversification of customers, and continuous improvement in underwriting results.

feed.title: Hippo's CEO wants to turn his newly public insurance company into the be-all, end-all for home services
feed.summary: Hippo CEO Assaf Wand envisions his newly public, $6 billion Palo Alto-based insurance company as the central hub for home services, moving beyond just offering insurance. Wand aims for Hippo to be the "1-800" equivalent for all home-related needs. He emphasizes that this vision does not involve expanding into other types of insurance.

feed.title: Hippo CEO Hopes Listing Will Fuel Better Insurance Coverage for Homeowners
feed.summary: Hippo Enterprises Inc. is going public with a $5 billion valuation to disrupt the homeowners' insurance market using data and technology. CEO Assaf Wand aims to use the $638 million generated from the listing to invest in tech, data, and engineering to offer faster, easier coverage and proactive homeowner solutions. While showing strong growth in premiums, the company faces risks from a potential housing market downturn and the need to achieve steady profitability to satisfy investors.

feed.title: Hippo Completes Business Combination with Reinvent Technology Partners Z to Become Publicly Traded Company
feed.summary: Hippo Holdings Inc. has completed its business combination with Reinvent Technology Partners Z (NYSE: RTPZ), and will begin trading on the NYSE under the ticker symbols "HIPO" and "HIPO.WS" starting August 3, 2021. The transaction is expected to raise over $550 million in cash proceeds to fuel growth, market expansion, product development, and geographic expansion, aiming to create a vertically integrated home protection and insurance platform. Assaf Wand will continue to lead Hippo as CEO and Co-Founder, focusing on modernizing the home insurance industry.
